attributes.action: Government organisation selling supplies to fund nhs during future pandemics
attributes.additional_details: Rather then companies profiting off increased sales a government owned brand which products help to supply the public and in turn support our services , general sale profits throughout the year can be donated to other worthy cause like helping the homeless, when not needed the government can keep half of the profits or reserve incase of a national emergency. I'm sure the public would fully support and buy these products knowing they will go to a good cause.
attributes.background: Government buisness which supplies emergency products all year round such as facemasks,hand sanitizer, latex gloves and toilet rolls to major retailers in preparation of future pandemics. Public sales will increase and all net profit will go towards funding research and supporting the nhs.

rejection.details:
The Government is responsible for providing public services, not operating businesses for a profit.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to Set up nationalised manufacturing of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317513

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
